logTitle: IELTS Reading Log: Bats to the rescue (Part 1)

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...where relations between agriculture and conservation are more strained.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Các mối quan hệ' (relations) 'trở nên căng thẳng hơn' (are more strained).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: When the relationship between two groups or ideas becomes more difficult, tense, or unfriendly.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các mối quan hệ trở nên căng thẳng hơn.

phase3Production.content: Relations between the two countries have become strained after the border dispute.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...relations between agriculture and conservation are more strained.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Nông nghiệp' (agriculture) 'và' (and) 'bảo tồn' (conservation).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The two fields of farming/growing crops and protecting the natural environment.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nông nghiệp và bảo tồn.

phase3Production.content: Finding a balance between agriculture and conservation is a key challenge.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Madagascar's forests are being converted to agricultural land...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đang bị 'chuyển đổi' (converted) 'thành' (to) 'đất nông nghiệp' (agricultural land).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be changed from one use (forest) to another (land for farming).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bị chuyển đổi thành đất nông nghiệp.

phase3Production.content: Large areas of rainforest are being converted to agricultural land for cattle ranching.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...at a rate of one percent every year.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Với tốc độ' (at a rate of) 'một phần trăm' (one percent) 'mỗi năm' (every year).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A measurement of the speed at which something happens.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Với tốc độ/tỷ lệ là.

phase3Production.content: The population is growing at a rate of 2% per year.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Much of this destruction is fuelled by the cultivation of the country's main staple crop: rice.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự tàn phá này 'bị thúc đẩy bởi/bị gây ra bởi' (fuelled by) 'việc trồng trọt' (the cultivation of) 'cây lương thực chính' (main staple crop).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be caused or made worse by something (e.g., cultivation).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bị thúc đẩy/tiếp tay bởi (việc trồng trọt...).

phase3Production.content: The conflict was fuelled by economic inequality and political corruption.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...fuelled by the cultivation of the country's main staple crop: rice.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Việc trồng trọt/canh tác' (cultivation) 'cây lương thực chính' (main staple crop).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process of preparing land and growing crops on it.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự/việc trồng trọt, canh tác.

phase3Production.content: The cultivation of olives has been a tradition in this region for centuries.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the country's main staple crop: rice.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Cây lương thực' (crop) 'chủ yếu/chính' (main staple).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The most important crop that forms the basic part of the diet for the people of a country.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cây lương thực chính.

phase3Production.content: Rice is the main staple crop for more than half of the world's population.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...is that insect pests are destroying vast quantities of what is grown...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Sâu bệnh/côn trùng' (insect) 'gây hại' (pests).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Insects that are harmful to crops, animals, or people.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sâu bệnh, côn trùng gây hại.

phase3Production.content: Farmers use various methods to protect their crops from insect pests.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...insect pests are destroying vast quantities of what is grown...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Phá hủy' (destroying) 'số lượng/khối lượng' (quantities) 'khổng lồ' (vast) 'của' (of) những gì trồng được.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To ruin or wipe out extremely large amounts of something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phá hủy số lượng/khối lượng khổng lồ.

phase3Production.content: The wildfire destroyed vast quantities of forest.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...what is grown by local subsistence farmers...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'nông dân' (farmers) 'tự cung tự cấp/canh tác đủ sống' (subsistence).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Farmers who grow crops mainly to feed themselves and their families, with little or no surplus for sale.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nông dân tự cung tự cấp.

phase3Production.content: In many developing countries, the majority of the population are subsistence farmers.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...leading them to clear forest to create new paddy fields.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Khiến họ/dẫn đến việc họ' (leading them to) 'phá rừng' (clear forest).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Causing them to take a particular action as a result.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khiến họ/dẫn họ đến (việc làm gì).

phase3Production.content: His poor exam results are leading him to reconsider his university choices.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...leading them to clear forest to create new paddy fields.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Phá/phát quang' (clear) 'rừng' (forest).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To cut down and remove all the trees from an area of forest.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phá rừng, phát quang rừng.

phase3Production.content: The company had to clear forest to build the new factory.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to create new paddy fields.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các 'cánh đồng lúa' (paddy fields).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A flooded field where rice is grown.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đồng lúa (nước).

phase3Production.content: The landscape is dominated by terraced paddy fields.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The result is devastating habitat and biodiversity loss on the island...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Môi trường sống' (habitat) 'bị tàn phá' (devastating) (đây là adj, nhưng có thể hiểu là 'sự tàn phá môi trường sống').

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Causing severe and widespread damage to the natural home or environment of an animal or plant.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: (Sự) tàn phá môi trường sống.

phase3Production.content: The oil spill had a devastating habitat loss for marine birds.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...habitat and biodiversity loss on the island...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'mất mát/suy giảm' (loss) 'đa dạng sinh học' (biodiversity).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The reduction in the variety of life (species, ecosystems) in a particular area.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự suy giảm/mất mát đa dạng sinh học.

phase3Production.content: Biodiversity loss is one of the most serious environmental crises we face.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...some of the island's insectivorous bats are currently thriving...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: (Những con dơi) 'ăn côn trùng' (insectivorous).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: (Of an animal) feeding on insects.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: (Thuộc loài) ăn côn trùng.

phase3Production.content: Many small birds are insectivorous, helping to control garden pests.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...are currently thriving and this has important implications for...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đang 'phát triển mạnh, thịnh vượng' (thriving).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be growing, developing, or succeeding very well; flourishing.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phát triển mạnh, thịnh vượng.

phase3Production.content: The new tech company is thriving in a competitive market.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...this has important implications for farmers and conservationists alike.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có 'những hàm ý/ảnh hưởng' (implications) 'quan trọng' (important) 'đối với' (for) nông dân và nhà bảo tồn.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have significant effects or consequences that will happen in the future.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: (Có) những hàm ý / hệ quả quan trọng đối với.

phase3Production.content: The discovery of water on Mars has important implications for the search for life.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...farmers and conservationists alike.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các 'nhà bảo tồn' (conservationists).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A person who works to protect animals, plants, and natural resources.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nhà bảo tồn.

phase3Production.content: Conservationists are working to save the endangered mountain gorilla.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Enter University of Cambridge zoologist Ricardo Rocha.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nhà 'động vật học' (zoologist).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A scientist who studies animals and their behaviour.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nhà động vật học.

phase3Production.content: The famous zoologist Jane Goodall spent years studying chimpanzees.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: He's passionate about conservation, and bats.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Anh ấy 'đam mê/say mê' (passionate about) 'việc bảo tồn' (conservation).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Having or showing strong feelings of enthusiasm or excitement for something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đam mê, say mê (cái gì).

phase3Production.content: She is passionate about human rights and social justice.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...how bats are responding to human activity and deforestation in particular.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Loài dơi đang 'phản ứng/thích ứng' (responding) 'với' (to) 'hoạt động của con người' (human activity).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Reacting or adapting to the actions and changes caused by people.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phản ứng/thích ứng với hoạt động của con người.

phase3Production.content: Wildlife is responding to human activity in unpredictable ways.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...human activity and deforestation in particular.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Và 'nạn phá rừng' (deforestation) 'nói riêng' (in particular).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The action of clearing a wide area of trees.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nạn phá rừng.

phase3Production.content: Deforestation in the Amazon is a major contributor to climate change.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...bats are giving Madagascar's rice farmers a vital pest control service...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'dịch vụ' (service) 'kiểm soát sâu bệnh' (pest control) 'thiết yếu/sống còn' (vital).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An extremely important and necessary function that helps to manage or kill harmful insects.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dịch vụ kiểm soát sâu bệnh thiết yếu.

phase3Production.content: Bees provide a vital pest control service by pollinating flowers, which also helps crops.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...by feasting on plagues of insects.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bằng cách 'ăn/đánh chén' (feasting on) 'đàn/dịch' (plagues) 'côn trùng' (of insects).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To eat large quantities of something with great enjoyment (in this case, large, destructive swarms of insects).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ăn tiệc, đánh chén (đàn/dịch côn trùng).

phase3Production.content: The lions were feasting on their kill.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...can ease the financial pressure on farmers to turn forest into fields.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có thể 'giảm bớt' (ease) 'áp lực' (pressure) 'tài chính' (financial) 'đối với' (on) nông dân.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make a difficult money situation less severe, intense, or stressful.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Giảm bớt áp lực tài chính đối với.

phase3Production.content: The new government subsidy will help ease the financial pressure on small businesses.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Bats comprise roughly one-fifth of all mammal species in Madagascar...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Dơi 'chiếm/bao gồm' (comprise) 'khoảng' (roughly) 'một phần năm' (one-fifth) 'tổng số' (of all) 'loài' (species) 'động vật có vú' (mammal).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To consist of; to be made up of.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bao gồm, chiếm (tỷ lệ).

phase3Production.content: People under the age of 30 comprise the majority of the company's workforce.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...one-fifth of all mammal species in Madagascar...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các 'loài' (species) 'động vật có vú' (mammal).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Types or kinds of animals that are mammals (warm-blooded, have fur, and feed milk to their young).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các loài động vật có vú.

phase3Production.content: Whales and dolphins are marine mammal species.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and thirty-six recorded bat species are native to the island...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Là 'bản địa' (native) 'của' (to) 'hòn đảo' (the island).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Existing naturally in a particular place; indigenous.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: (Là) bản địa của (hòn đảo).

phase3Production.content: The kangaroo is a mammal that is native to Australia.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...making it one of the most important regions for conservation of this animal group...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một trong những 'khu vực' (regions) 'quan trọng nhất' (most important) 'cho việc bảo tồn' (for conservation).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Areas of the world that are considered highly important for protecting wildlife and natural habitats.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các khu vực (quan trọng) cho (việc) bảo tồn.

phase3Production.content: The Amazon rainforest is one of the world's most critical regions for conservation.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Co-leading an international team of scientists, Rocha found that...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Đồng' (Co-) 'lãnh đạo' (leading) 'một' (an) 'đội/nhóm' (team) 'quốc tế' (international).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To share the leadership or management of a group or project with one or more other people.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đồng lãnh đạo, đồng chủ trì.

phase3Production.content: She is co-leading the research project with a professor from another university.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...several species of indigenous bats are taking advantage of...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các loài dơi 'bản địa' (indigenous).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Bats that are native to a particular region or country; originating naturally in a place.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dơi bản địa.

phase3Production.content: The Maori are the indigenous people of New Zealand.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...indigenous bats are taking advantage of habitat modification to hunt...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đang 'tận dụng/lợi dụng' (taking advantage of) 'sự thay đổi môi trường sống' (habitat modification).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make good use of an opportunity or situation.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tận dụng (lợi thế, cơ hội).

phase3Production.content: We should take advantage of the sunny weather and go to the beach.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...taking advantage of habitat modification to hunt insects...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'thay đổi/biến đổi' (modification) 'môi trường sống' (habitat).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Changes that are made to the natural environment of an animal or plant, often by human activity.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự thay đổi/biến đổi môi trường sống.

phase3Production.content: Habitat modification due to farming is a major threat to wildlife.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to hunt insects swarming above the country's rice fields.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Săn' (hunt) 'côn trùng' (insects) 'bay thành đàn/lúc nhúc' (swarming) 'ở trên' (above) đồng lúa.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To chase and catch insects that are moving in a large, dense group.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Săn côn trùng bay thành đàn/lúc nhúc ở trên.

phase3Production.content: The birds were hunting insects swarming above the lake at sunset.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: They include the Malagasy mouse-eared bat...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một loài dơi (bat) 'tai chuột' (mouse-eared) ở Malagasy.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A species of bat characterized by its ears, which resemble those of a mouse.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dơi tai chuột.

phase3Production.content: The mouse-eared bat is common in many parts of Europe.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Major's long-fingered bat...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Dơi 'ngón tay dài' (long-fingered).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A species of bat known for its unusually long finger bones, which support its wings.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dơi ngón tay dài.

phase3Production.content: The long-fingered bat is an expert at catching insects over water.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the Malagasy white-bellied free-tailed bat...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Dơi 'đuôi không dính' (free-tailed) 'bụng trắng' (white-bellied).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A species of bat with a white underside and a tail that extends beyond the wing membrane.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dơi đuôi rời bụng trắng.

phase3Production.content: The free-tailed bat is known for flying at very high altitudes.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and Peters' wrinkle-lipped bat.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Dơi 'môi nhăn' (wrinkle-lipped).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A species of bat characterized by distinctive wrinkles or folds on its lips.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dơi môi nhăn.

phase3Production.content: The wrinkle-lipped bat often forms massive colonies in caves.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: 'These winner species are providing a valuable free service...'

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đang 'cung cấp' (providing) 'một dịch vụ' (a service) 'miễn phí' (free) 'có giá trị' (valuable).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To offer an important or useful function at no cost.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cung cấp một dịch vụ miễn phí quý giá.

phase3Production.content: Pollinators like bees are providing a valuable free service to agriculture.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...as biological pest suppressors,' says Rocha.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: (Với tư cách là) 'những tác nhân' (suppressors) 'kiểm soát/đàn áp' (suppressors) 'sâu bệnh' (pest) 'sinh học' (biological).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Living organisms (like bats) that naturally control or reduce the populations of harmful pests.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tác nhân/loài ức chế sâu bệnh sinh học.

phase3Production.content: Ladybugs are well-known biological pest suppressors, as they eat aphids.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: 'We found that six species of bat are preying on rice pests...'

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đang 'săn mồi/ăn thịt' (preying on) 'sâu bệnh' (pests) 'trên lúa' (rice).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To hunt and kill another animal (in this case, rice pests) for food.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Săn/ăn thịt (sâu bệnh hại lúa).

phase3Production.content: Owls are nocturnal birds that prey on mice and other small rodents.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...including the paddy swarming caterpillar and grass webworm.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Sâu' (caterpillar) 'bướm' (caterpillar) 'bay thành đàn' (swarming) 'hại lúa' (paddy).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A type of insect larva (caterpillar) that moves in large, destructive groups and eats rice plants.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sâu keo (hại lúa).

phase3Production.content: The paddy swarming caterpillar can destroy an entire rice field in a few nights.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and grass webworm.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một loại 'sâu' (worm) 'đan mạng' (web) 'trên cỏ' (grass).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A type of caterpillar that spins silky webs in grassy areas and feeds on the grass.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sâu đan mạng (hại cỏ/lúa).

phase3Production.content: The grass webworm is a common pest in lawns and rice fields.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...causes the farmers under huge financial pressure and that encourages deforestation.'

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Gây ra 'áp lực' (pressure) 'tài chính' (financial) 'khổng lồ' (huge) 'cho' (under) 'nông dân' (farmers).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A very large amount of stress or difficulty related to money.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Áp lực tài chính khổng lồ.

phase3Production.content: The company is under huge financial pressure to cut costs.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The study... set out to investigate the feeding activity of insectivorous bats...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nghiên cứu 'bắt đầu/đặt mục tiêu' (set out to) 'điều tra' (investigate) 'hoạt động' (activity) 'ăn' (feeding).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To start an activity with a particular aim or intention.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bắt đầu (làm gì), đặt mục tiêu (làm gì).

phase3Production.content: They set out to build the most advanced computer in the world.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to investigate the feeding activity of insectivorous bats...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Hoạt động' (activity) 'kiếm ăn/ăn mồi' (feeding).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The behavior and actions of an animal related to finding and consuming food.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hoạt động kiếm ăn/ăn mồi.

phase3Production.content: The zoologist observed the lions' feeding activity from a safe distance.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...in the farmland bordering the Ranomafana National Park...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Đất nông nghiệp' (farmland) 'giáp ranh/nằm sát' (bordering) 'Công viên Quốc gia' (National Park).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Agricultural land that is adjacent to or shares a boundary with another area (like a park).
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đất nông nghiệp giáp ranh/nằm sát (một nơi).

phase3Production.content: The study focused on wildlife in the farmland bordering the protected forest.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...in the southeast of the country.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Ở 'phía đông nam' (southeast) 'của' (of) 'đất nước' (the country).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The direction or area that is halfway between south and east.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: (Phía) đông nam.

phase3Production.content: Vietnam is a country in Southeast Asia.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Rocha and his team used state-of-the-art ultrasonic recorders...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Hiện đại/tối tân' (state-of-the-art) 'máy ghi âm' (recorders) 'siêu âm' (ultrasonic).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Very modern and using the most recent ideas and methods.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hiện đại nhất, tối tân nhất.

phase3Production.content: The new hospital is equipped with state-of-the-art medical technology.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...used state-of-the-art ultrasonic recorders to record over a thousand bat 'feeding buzzes'...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Máy ghi âm' (recorders) 'sóng siêu âm' (ultrasonic).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Devices that can capture sounds at frequencies higher than the range of human hearing.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Máy ghi (sóng) siêu âm.

phase3Production.content: Scientists use ultrasonic recorders to study bat communication.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...record over a thousand bat 'feeding buzzes' (echolocation sequences used by bats to target their prey)...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Tiếng 'vo ve' (buzzes) 'khi kiếm ăn' (feeding) (âm thanh định vị con mồi).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The specific sequence of echolocation calls a bat makes when it is honing in on and about to capture prey.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tiếng vo ve (định vị) khi bắt mồi.

phase3Production.content: It's the special, fast sound a bat makes right when it's about to catch an insect, like 'locking on' to its target.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...(echolocation sequences used by bats to target their prey)...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Chuỗi/trình tự' (sequences) 'định vị bằng tiếng vang' (echolocation).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A series of high-frequency sounds (calls) emitted by an animal (like a bat) to determine the location of objects by the returning echoes.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chuỗi/trình tự định vị bằng tiếng vang.

noun.meaning: sự định vị bằng tiếng vang
